channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anerley court fly tipping, 16th June
item.description:
Can I ask how we have gone from an enforced £2500 fine for fly tipping to a total unforced fly tipping culture along anerley park? In particular the large blocks of flats - anerley court and linden court? Our council tax has almost double in the last few years but the enforceability has seemingly dropped off a cliff. Please can you explain why these fines are not being imposed anymore and there appears to be a total disregard for local residents concerns?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 16th June
item.description:
Yet again dumped rubbish at recycling containers. Rubbish bags have been ripped open and spilling onto street. This is a constant issue and rubbish being dumped here pretty much every day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London

item.title: More fly tipping 9 penge high street, 16th June
item.description:
You literally have the name of the person who is, on an almost daily basis, leaving rubbish on the pavement for the rest of us to walk around. Please can you explain what is being done about this individual?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, High Street, Penge, London

item.title: Bike abandoned on our street, 16th June
item.description:
Someone left their broken bike on our street and has been here for a few weeks now. Please can somebody come to collect as it’s making out street look messy. It is also dangerous if it falls on somebody especially a child walking or running by. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree has overhanging branches which hang so low they knock you in the face. Also the growth from soil level around the bottom of the trunk stretches onto the pavement. It makes it difficult to walk past especially if you are a wheelchair user or have a baby buggy. You have to walk in the road and navigate around parked cars as photo shows., 16th June
item.description:
The overgrowth is a risk hazard especially for vulnerable people. It’s been like this for months. It needs to be cut right back. It’s on Churchbury Lane very close to Enfield Council offices!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchbury Lane, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally using traffic cones again, 16th June
item.description:
The people at 30 Harwood Avenue, Bromley BR1 are using traffic cones illegally again. They have put three cones out this time to prevent people parking legally in the road and paying Bromley Councils parking team. They have an illegal side entry to their house which they are using to drive over the pavement (already criminally damaged lots of paving slabs driving illegally over the pavement with heavy vehicles). This needs to be stopped. People need parking spaces. Keeping them for their personal use and ‘reserving’ the spaces is not fair. Nominate fact that we will then have to pay for all of the paving slabs in the pavement they have damaged. Worse still if someone trips on the broken slabs and sues you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Blaise Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
